post.description: Use the Get Transaction History endpoint to retrieve a list of posted transactions (settlements, payments, adjustments, fees) during a specified timespan. This endpoint does not return unsettled authorizations. - As desired, use the `act_type` field in the response to filter the responses by transaction type. - See Record-Set Pagination for instructions on using the paging parameters. - Open the Recipe below to see a response example.

apiLogin.description:
Web service username, as provided by Galileo.
Pattern: Max 50 characters
Example: `"AbC123-9999"`

apiTransKey.description:
Web service password, as provided by Galileo.
Pattern: Max 15 characters
Example: `"4sb62fh6w4h7w34g"`

providerId.description:
Galileo-issued provider identifier.
Pattern: Max 10 digits
Example: `9999`

transactionId.description:
A unique provider-generated ID to identify this API call. A UUID is preferred.
Pattern: 60 characters or less
Example: `"9845dk-39fdk3fj3-4483483478"`

accountNo.description:
The <<glossary:PRN>> or <<glossary:PAN>> of the account.
Pattern: PAN or PRN 
Example: `"074103447228"`

startDate.description:
The beginning date for the date range, either a date or a date-time.
Pattern: YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss
Example: `"2016-01-01"`

endDate.description:
The end date for the date range, either a date or a date-time. Must be equal to or later than `startDate`. Max 1098 days (~3 years) after `startDate`. 
Pattern: YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss
Example: `"2016-01-01"`

recordCnt.description:
The maximum number of records per page to be returned.
Pattern: Positive integer `1-99999`
Example: `100`

page.description:
The number of the page to retrieve.
Pattern: Integer value of `1` or greater
Example: `3`

includeRelated.description: Whether to return data for related accounts. See Getting related account information for instructions on using this parameter. Default is `1`. Pattern: `0` or `1` Example: `0`

status_code.description: The response status code. May return a string for some statuses.

status.description: The condition of a process or response

processing_time.description: The time elapsed in processing the transaction

echo.description: A structure that contains transaction ID information

transaction_id.description: An ID that represents an API transaction

provider_timestamp.description: Store a related timestamp for reporting and troubleshooting purposes

provider_transaction_id.description: Secondary transaction identifier (generated by a provider)

rtoken.description: A Galileo-generated ID used for tracking

errors.description: A list of errors generated while the request was processed

response_data.description: A structure for the response data. It can be empty but usually will contain information.

start_date.description: The start date for the transaction range

end_date.description: The end date for the transaction range

number_of_pages.description: The total number of pages available in the paginated response

page.description: The current page being retunred in the paginated response

total_record_count.description: Number of records in the accounts list display

transaction_count.description: The number of transactions listed in the response

pmt_ref_no.description: Galileo-generated account number. Also called the PRN.

act_id.description: Transaction activity identifier used in Galileo's system

act_type.description: Identifier for the transaction activity type. See the Activity Type enumeration.

post_ts.description: Galileo system timestamp when the transaction posted to the customer account, in Mountain Standard Time (-0700)

amt.description: The transaction amount in the currency of the account. A negative amount debits funds from the customer account.

details.description: Description provided by the merchant about the transaction (DE043)

description.description: Description of the activity type specified in the `act_type` field. See the Activity Type enumeration.

source_id.description: Galileo-generated identifier that maps to the original transaction, such as `auth_id`, `pmt_id`, or `adj_id`

bal_id.description: Balance ID, a Galileo-generated identifier for the account on which the transaction occurs. Maps to `galileo_account_number`.

prod_id.description: Identifier for the product associated with the account

auth_ts.description: Galileo system timestamp when the transaction was authorized, in Mountain Standard Time (-0700)

trans_code.description: Reference your program's activity and transaction types for possible values.

ach_transaction_id.description: Identifier for the ACH transaction, if applicable

external_trans_id.description: Optional identifier for a transaction that you supply. External to the Galileo system.

original_auth_id.description: The `auth_id` of the previous transaction in the sequence, if any. Maps to `prior_id`.

network_code.description: A Galileo-generated code to identify the subnetwork over which the transaction took place. Maps to `network_id`.

local_amt.description: Amount, in cents, of the authorization request, in the currency at the point of sale. 12-digit number including leading zeros. This amount does not include upcharges or program fees. (DE004)

settle_amt.description: The transaction amount in the settlement currency (DE005)

billing_amt.description: The transaction amount in the currency of the account (DE006)

mcc.description: Category code for the merchant that initiated the transaction (DE018)

formatted_merchant_desc.description: The same information as in the `details` field, with formatting

terminal_id.description: Identifier for the card reader at the point of sale (DE041)

card_id.description: A Galileo-generated identifier for a card, which can be used instead of the PAN. Maps to `cad`.

credit_ind.description: Indicates whether a PIN was input at the point of sale. `Y` = No PIN was input. `N` = A PIN was input. `None` = Not a card transaction.

iac_tax.description: Impuesto al Consumo. Colombian consumption tax. Required for the Mastercard Interchange Intracountry Calculation Program.

iva_tax.description: Impuesto al Valor Agregado. Colombian value-added tax. Required for the Mastercard Interchange Intracountry Calculation Program.

spending_account_prn.description: The PRN of the RTF spending account

post.description: Use the Get Balance endpoint to retrieve the specified account balance and its currency code. This endpoint returns the balance for all accounts that share the same balance ID (Galileo account number).

apiLogin.description:
Web service username, as provided by Galileo.
Pattern: Max 50 characters
Example: `"AbC123-9999"`

apiTransKey.description:
Web service password, as provided by Galileo.
Pattern: Max 15 characters
Example: `"4sb62fh6w4h7w34g"`

providerId.description:
Galileo-issued provider identifier.
Pattern: Max 10 digits
Example: `9999`

transactionId.description:
A unique provider-generated ID to identify this API call. A UUID is preferred.
Pattern: 60 characters or less
Example: `"9845dk-39fdk3fj3-4483483478"`

accountNo.description:
The <<glossary:PRN>> or <<glossary:PAN>> of the account.
Pattern: PAN or PRN 
Example: `"074103447228"`

status_code.description: The response status code. May return a string for some statuses.

status.description: The condition of a process or response

processing_time.description: The time elapsed in processing the transaction

echo.description: A structure that contains transaction ID information

transaction_id.description: An ID that represents an API transaction

provider_timestamp.description: Store a related timestamp for reporting and troubleshooting purposes

provider_transaction_id.description: Secondary transaction identifier (generated by a provider)

rtoken.description: A Galileo-generated ID used for tracking

errors.description: A list of errors generated while the request was processed

response_data.description: A structure for the response data. It can be empty but usually will contain information.

balance.description: For debit accounts, this is the available balance to spend, meaning the total of all posted transactions with all pending transactions subtracted out. For credit accounts this is the unpaid balance.

balance_without_pending.description: For debit accounts, the total of all posted transactions with only pending authorizations subtracted out. For credit accounts this is the same as `balance`.

currency_code.description: A three-digit ISO 4217 code for the currency of the account. All amounts in this response are in this currency.

pending_adjustments.description: Total of all adjustments created by a batch process. This value will almost always be `0`.

pending_billpay.description: The total amount of pending bill payments. A bill payment is pending between the time it is created and when the amount is adjusted out of the account.

pending_purchase.description: Amounts from a deprecated feature. This value will always be `0`.

balance_without_auths.description: The `balance` without subtracting out authorization holds. This field is populated only when the BWOOA parameter is set.

status_code.description: The response status code. May return a string for some statuses.

status.description: The condition of a process or response

processing_time.description: The time elapsed in processing the transaction

echo.description: A structure that contains transaction ID information

transaction_id.description: An ID that represents an API transaction

provider_timestamp.description: Store a related timestamp for reporting and troubleshooting purposes

provider_transaction_id.description: Secondary transaction identifier (generated by a provider)

rtoken.description: A Galileo-generated ID used for tracking

errors.description: A list of errors generated while the request was processed

response_data.description: A structure for the response data. It can be empty but usually will contain information.

auth_id.description: A Galileo-generated identifier for an authorization.

details.description: Description provided by the merchant about the transaction (DE043)

details_formatted.description: The same information as in the `details` field, with formatting

amount.description: The authorization amount, in the currency of the account

timestamp.description: The Galileo system timestamp for the authorization, in Mountain Standard Time (-0700)

type.description: Reference your program's authorization transaction types for possible values.

mcc.description: Category code for the merchant that initiated the transaction (DE018)

terminal_id.description: Identifier for the card reader at the point of sale (DE041)

can_be_expired.description: Whether to allow an expiration on this authorization: `1` = Allow, or `0`  = Do not allow

original_auth_id.description: The `auth_id` of the previous transaction in the sequence, if any. Maps to `prior_id` in other contexts.

network_code.description: A Galileo-generated code to identify the network over which the transaction took place. Maps to `network_id`.

local_amt.description: Amount in cents of the transaction based on the currency at the point of sale (DE004). 12-digit number including leading zeros.

settle_amt.description: The transaction amount, in cents, in the settlement currency (DE005). 12-digit number including leading zeros.

billing_amt.description: The billing amount in cents (DE006). 12-digit number including leading zeros.

iac_tax.description: Impuesto al Consumo. Colombian consumption tax. Required for the Mastercard Interchange Intracountry Calculation Program.

iva_tax.description: Impuesto al Valor Agregado. Colombian value-added tax. Required for the Mastercard Interchange Intracountry Calculation Program.

post.description: Use the Get Authorization History endpoint to retrieve a list of authorizations that have not settled, expired, or been reversed. - See Record-Set Pagination for instructions on using the paging parameters. - Open the Recipe below to see a response example.

apiLogin.description:
Web service username, as provided by Galileo.
Pattern: Max 50 characters
Example: `"AbC123-9999"`

apiTransKey.description:
Web service password, as provided by Galileo.
Pattern: Max 15 characters
Example: `"4sb62fh6w4h7w34g"`

providerId.description:
Galileo-issued provider identifier.
Pattern: Max 10 digits
Example: `9999`

transactionId.description:
A unique provider-generated ID to identify this API call. A UUID is preferred.
Pattern: 60 characters or less
Example: `"9845dk-39fdk3fj3-4483483478"`

accountNo.description:
The <<glossary:PRN>> or <<glossary:PAN>> of the account.
Pattern: PAN or PRN
Example: `"074103447228"`

startDate.description:
The beginning date for the date range, either a date or a date-time.
Pattern: YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss
Example: `"2016-01-01"`

endDate.description:
The end date for the date range, either a date or a date-time. Must be equal to or later than `startDate`. Max 1098 days (~3 years) after `startDate`. 
Pattern: YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss
Example: `"2016-01-01"`

recordCnt.description:
The maximum number of records per page to be returned.
Pattern: Positive integer `1-99999`
Example: `100`

includeRelated.description: Whether to return data for related accounts. See Getting related account information for instructions on using this parameter. Default is `1`. Pattern: `0` or `1` Example: `0`

post.description: Use the Get Account Overview endpoint to retrieve the combined response data from several other endpoints. Best practice is to use this endpoint to retrieve the data for a customer's landing page or other similar display. Data sets returned by Get Account Overview: - General account information (balance, status, application date) - Cardholder profile data - Posted transactions - Pending card authorizations - Pending fees (generally because of insufficient funds) - Savings interest data, applicable only if an associated savings account exists; otherwise, a unary `savings_interest` element is returned. > 📘 Note > >Transactions created by Program API endpoints (such as Create Payment, Create Adjustment, and Create Account Transfer) are not present in this endpoint's response for several seconds after creation.

status_code.description: The response status code. May return a string for some statuses.

status.description: The condition of a process or response

processing_time.description: The time elapsed in processing the transaction

echo.description: A structure that contains transaction ID information

transaction_id.description: An ID that represents an API transaction

provider_timestamp.description: Store a related timestamp for reporting and troubleshooting purposes

provider_transaction_id.description: Secondary transaction identifier (generated by a provider)

rtoken.description: A Galileo-generated ID used for tracking

errors.description: A list of errors generated while the request was processed

response_data.description: A structure for the response data. It can be empty but usually will contain information.

pmt_ref_no.description: Galileo-generated account number. Also called the PRN.

status.description: Status of the account

application_date.description: Date the account application was received

currency_code.description: A three-character code to represent global currencies

address_1.description: First line of the account holder's address

address_2.description: Second line of the account holder's address

country_code.description: The ISO 3166 international standard for country codes. Identifies the account holder's country.

address_1.description: First line of the shipping address

address_2.description: Second line of the shipping address

postal_code.description: Postal code for the shipping address

country_code.description: ISO 3166 country code indicating the country for the shipping address

express_mail.description: Indicates whether to use express mail for shipping

start_date.description: The start date for the range that account information is displayed

end_date.description: The end date for the range that account information is displayed

transaction_count.description: The number of transactions listed in the response

pmt_ref_no.description: Galileo-generated account number. Also called the PRN.

act_id.description: Transaction activity identifier used in Galileo's system

act_type.description: AIdentifier for the transaction activity type. See the Activity Type enumeration.

mcc.description: Merchant Category Code (MCC) for the merchant that initiated the transaction (DE018)

post_ts.description: The Galileo system timestamp when the transaction posted to the customer account, in Mountain Standard Time (-0700)

amt.description: The transaction amount in the currency of the account. A negative amount debits funds from the customer account.

details.description: Description provided by the merchant about the transaction (DE043)

description.description: Description of the activity type (`act_type`). See the Activity Type enumeration.

source_id.description: Galileo-generated identifier that maps to the original transaction, such as `auth_id`, `pmt_id`, or `adj_id`

bal_id.description: Balance ID, a Galileo-generated identifier for the account on which the transaction occurs. Maps to `galileo_account_number`.

prod_id.description: Identifier for the product associated with the account

auth_ts.description: Galileo system timestamp when the transaction was authorized, in Mountain Standard Time (-0700)

trans_code.description: Reference your program's activity and transaction types for possible values.

ach_transaction_id.description: Identifier for the ACH transaction, if applicable

external_trans_id.description: Optional identifier for a transaction that you supply. External to the Galileo system.

original_auth_id.description: The `auth_id` of the previous transaction in the sequence, if any. Maps to `prior_id`.

network_id.description: A Galileo-generated code to identify the subnetwork over which the transaction took place. Maps to `network_code`.

local_amt.description: Amount, in cents, of the authorization request, in the currency at the point of sale. 12-digit number including leading zeros. This amount does not include upcharges or program fees. (DE004)

settle_amt.description: The transaction amount, in cents, in the settlement currency (DE005). 12-digit number including leading zeros.

billing_amt.description: The transaction amount, in cents, in the currency of the account (DE006). 12-digit number including leading zeros.

iac_tax.description: Impuesto al Consumo. Colombian consumption tax. Required for the Mastercard Interchange Intracountry Calculation Program.

iva_tax.description: Impuesto al Valor Agregado. Colombian value-added tax. Required for the Mastercard Interchange Intracountry Calculation Program.

spending_account_prn.description: The PRN of the RTF spending account

authorization_count.description: The number of authorizations listed in the response

auth_id.description: A Galileo-generated identifier for an authorization.

details.description: Description provided by the merchant about the transaction (DE043)

details_formatted.description: The same information as in the `details` field, with formatting

amount.description: The authorization amount, in the currency of the account

timestamp.description: The Galileo system timestamp for the authorization, in Mountain Standard Time (-0700)

type.description: Reference your program's authorization transaction types for possible values.

mcc.description: Category code for the merchant that initiated the transaction (DE018)

terminal_id.description: Identifier for the card reader at the point of sale (DE041)

can_be_expired.description: Whether to allow an expiration on this authorization: `1` = Allow, or `0`  = Do not allow

original_auth_id.description: The `auth_id` of the previous transaction in the sequence, if any. Maps to `prior_id` in other contexts.

network_code.description: A Galileo-generated code to identify the network over which the transaction took place. Maps to `network_id`.

local_amt.description: Amount in cents of the transaction based on the currency at the point of sale (DE004). 12-digit number including leading zeros.

settle_amt.description: The transaction amount, in cents, in the settlement currency (DE005). 12-digit number including leading zeros.

billing_amt.description: The billing amount in cents (DE006). 12-digit number including leading zeros.

iac_tax.description: Impuesto al Consumo. Colombian consumption tax. Required for the Mastercard Interchange Intracountry Calculation Program.

iva_tax.description: Impuesto al Valor Agregado. Colombian value-added tax. Required for the Mastercard Interchange Intracountry Calculation Program.

fee_event_id.description: Galileo generated fee transaction integer ID

type.description: Three-letter fee code. This is not the transaction type (otype).

type_description.description: A description of the type code

fee_date.description: A timestamp for the time the fee was charged

card_id.description: Integer identifier of the card as found in the raw data file (RDF). Unique identifier for a PAN.

related_transaction.description: A data structure that contains information on transactions related to a fee

details.description: Information on a transaction or authorization

amt.description: Amount of a fee or transaction charge

post_ts.description: The time stamp of a posted transaction

start_date.description: The start date for the period

end_date.description: The end date for the period

accrual_interest.description: Interest accrued on the account. May return an integer if the interest accrued is 0.

interest_ytd.description: The year-to-date interest paid on a savings account. May return an integer if the interest paid is 0.

apy.description: The Annual Percentage Yield Earned (APYE) for the requested month

holds.description: List of holds. Holds being returned are dependant on product parameters

create_dt.description: Timestamp when the hold was created

change_ts.description: Timestamp when the hold was changed

originating_system_id.description: Identifier that specifies the source system for the hold

agent_id.description: Identifier for the agent that created the hold

amount.description: The amount for the hold

xid.description: The transaction ID associated with the hold

expiring_system_id.description: Identifier for the process that expired the hold

expiring_agent_id.description: Identifier for the agent that expired the hold

status_code.description: The response status code. May return a string for some statuses.

status.description: The condition of a process or response

processing_time.description: The time elapsed in processing the transaction

echo.description: A structure that contains transaction ID information

transaction_id.description: An ID that represents an API transaction

provider_timestamp.description: Store a related timestamp for reporting and troubleshooting purposes

provider_transaction_id.description: Secondary transaction identifier (generated by a provider)

rtoken.description: A Galileo-generated ID used for tracking

errors.description: A list of errors generated while the request was processed

response_data.description: A structure for the response data. It can be empty but usually will contain information.

pmt_ref_no.description: Galileo-generated account number. Also called the PRN.

product_id.description: Identifier for the product associated with the account

cip.description: List of cardholder identification process (CIP) objects

status.description: Status of the CIP process

model_version.description: Version number for the model used

code.description: In a model run, lists the pass number

text.description: Plain text description of the code value

date_time.description: The date and time CIP was run

address_1.description: First line of the account holder's address

address_2.description: Second line of the account holder's address

card_id.description: Galileo-generated card identifier (CAD). Use this ID instead of the PAN if not PCI-compliant. `None` means that no card was created

new_emboss_uuid.description: UUID for an emboss record that has not yet been sent to the embosser.

card_number.description: The primary account number (PAN) printed on the card

emboss_line_2.description: Second line to emboss on the card

billing_cycle_day.description: The day of the month the billing cycle starts for the account

post.description: Use the Create Account endpoint to create an account for a new customer. You can use this endpoint for personalized, instant issue, and secondary products. This endpoint runs <> if you are using Galileo's integrated CIP process. In contrast with the Start Enrollment endpoint, Create Account creates a customer record and at the same time creates an account. Depending on product settings, it also creates a card and loads funds onto it. Consult the Creating an Account procedure for instructions on using this endpoint, and consult the Customer ID Verification guide for how to use this endpoint with Galileo's integrated CIP solution. The instructions include a flowchart to illustrate how Create Account works in the Galileo system. Also see Create Account vs Add Account in the *About Accounts* guide. > 📘 Note > > You can receive PCI-sensitive data only if your provider parameters permit it. #### Duplicate use of customer ID Galileo can configure your product parameters to allow or disallow the duplicate use of customer IDs such as SSNs across your programs. (If one of your prospective customers already has a product with another Galileo partner, no duplicate is detected.) #### CIP response If you are using Galileo's integrated <> solution, the Create Account response includes the verdict. Consult Create Account and Create Virtual Account Process in the *Customer ID Verification (CIP/KYC)* guide for more information. #### Test names in the CV environment In the <> environment only, you can use specific names with the Create Account endpoint to trigger different <> responses. For the `firstName`, `middleName`, and `lastName` parameters, use these values: * `John F Smith` — Triggers a CIP failure (F) * `John R Smith` — Triggers a CIP refer (R) * `John P Smith` — Triggers a CIP pass (P) Do not use these test names in <>. #### Required fields Most input parameters for this endpoint are not required, to accommodate various use cases. If you would like some of the parameters to be required, populate the PINED product parameter with the parameters to be required. For example: `idType,id`. If this endpoint returns a status code that does not match a status code that is specific to this endpoint, it may be an enrollment status code. See Enrollment Statuses for more information.

apiLogin.description:
Web service username, as provided by Galileo.
Pattern: Max 50 characters
Example: `"AbC123-9999"`

apiTransKey.description:
Web service password, as provided by Galileo.
Pattern: Max 15 characters
Example: `"4sb62fh6w4h7w34g"`

providerId.description:
Galileo-issued provider identifier.
Pattern: Max 10 digits
Example: `9999`

transactionId.description:
A unique provider-generated ID to identify this API call. A UUID is preferred.
Pattern: 60 characters or less
Example: `"9845dk-39fdk3fj3-4483483478"`

accountNo.description:
The <<glossary:PRN>> or <<glossary:PAN>> of the account.
Pattern: PAN or PRN
Example: `"074103447228"`

idType.description: Specifies the type of primary identifier in the `id` parameter. This parameter is **required** when `id` is populated. See the **ID** column in the Customer ID Types table for valid values. Pattern: 1- or 2-digit integer Example: `2`

id.description: The value of the primary identifier that is specified in `idType`. Product settings determine whether this ID should be unique across the program or product. This parameter is **required** when using Galileo's integrated <> solution. Pattern: As specified in the **Layout** column of the Customer ID Types enumeration Example: `"123456789"`

idType2.description: Specifies the type of secondary identifier in the `id2` parameter. This parameter is **required** when `id2` is populated. See the **ID** column in the Customer ID Types table for valid values. Pattern: 1- or 2-digit integer Example: `1`

id2.description: The value of the secondary identifier that is specified in `idType2`. Pattern: As specified in the **Layout** column of the Customer ID Types enumeration Example: `"123456789012|UT|12/25/2020"`

locationType.description:
Type of ID in `location`:
* `0` — Galileo location ID
* `1` — Partner location ID
* `2` — Don't validate

Pattern: `0`, `1`, or `2`
Example: `0`

location.description: Unique location identifier (`location`) as returned by the Create Location endpoint. This value is also returned by the Get Locations endpoint depending on the value of `locationType` when the location was created: * `0` or `2` — Returned in the `location_id` field * `1` — Returned in the `provider_specified_id` field Pattern: Integer if `locationType: 0` or `locationType: 2`; max 15 characters if `locationType: 1` Example: `"a455-3483"`

locale.description:
The account holder language and localization preference. Default is `en_US`. Valid values are `en_US`, `es_US`, `fr_CA`, `en_CA`, `es_MX`, `en_MX`. If the account holder address is outside the U.S., pass a non `_US` value for this parameter to disable U.S. address validation.
Pattern: Letters with underscore
Example: `"en_US"`

externalAccountId.description:
Identifier supplied by the provider, which is not related to the Galileo system. This ID is stored in the Galileo system in association with this account and can be provided in the <<glossary:RDF>>s.
Pattern: Max 30 alphanumeric characters. Lowercase only.
Example: `"553b45sbs"`

firstName.description: Account holder's first name. Special character support. Pattern: 1–40 characters: letters (`A-Z`, `a-z`), spaces, hyphens (`-`) and single quotes (`'`) Example: `"Ed"`

middleName.description: Account holder's middle name. Special character support. Pattern: 1–40 characters: letters (`A-Z`, `a-z`), spaces, hyphens (`-`) and single quotes (`'`) Example: `"W"`

lastName.description: Account holder's last name. Special character support. Pattern: 1–40 characters: letters (`A-Z`, `a-z`), spaces, hyphens (`-`) and single quotes (`'`) Example: `"Harley"`

dateOfBirth.description:
Account holder's birth date. This date is compared with the DOB product parameter when there is a minimum age requirement on the account.
Pattern: YYYY-MM-DD
Example: `"1980-01-01"`

address1.description: Account holder's first address line. Cannot be a P.O. box. Validation rules for `address1`. Pattern: 4–40 alphanumeric characters Example: `"33 Maple Street"`

address2.description: Account holder's second address line. Character set for address lines. Pattern: Max 40 characters Example: `"#4B"`

address3.description: Account holder's third address line. Character set for address lines. Pattern: Max 30 characters Example: `"Carrera Central"`

address4.description: Account holder's fourth address line. Character set for address lines. Pattern: Max 30 characters Example: `"Barrio El Alhambra"`

address5.description: Account holder's fifth address line. Character set for address lines. Pattern: Max 30 characters Example: `"Piso 3"`

city.description:
Account holder's city.
Pattern: Max 30 characters: letters, spaces, hyphen and period
Example: `"Salt Lake City"`

state.description:
Account holder's state or province.
Pattern: 2,3-character state or province abbreviation
Example: `"UT"`

postalCode.description:
Account holder's postal code (ZIP code).
Pattern: `1234`, `12345`, `12345-1234`, or `K1A-1A1`
Example: `"84121"`

countryCode.description:
Account holder's country. Three-digit UN M49 code, such as `840` for USA, `124` for Canada, `484` for Mexico, `170` for Colombia.
Pattern: 3-digit number
Example: `"840"`

primaryPhone.description:
Account holder's primary phone number. When passing a value for this parameter, you must also pass `mobilePhoneCountryCode`.
Pattern: Validation according to the value in `mobilePhoneCountryCode`.
 Example: `"8015556060"`

otherPhone.description:
Account holder's secondary phone number. When passing a value for this parameter, you must also pass `mobilePhoneCountryCode`.
Pattern: Validation according to the value in `mobilePhoneCountryCode`.
 Example: `"8015556060"`

mobilePhone.description:
Account holder's mobile phone number. When passing a value for this parameter, you must also pass `mobilePhoneCountryCode`.
Pattern: Validation according to the value in `mobilePhoneCountryCode`.
 Example: `"8015556060"`

mobileCarrierId.description:
Account holder's mobile carrier. Configurable list.
Pattern: Configurable list
Example: `"8"`

email.description:
Account holder's email. The Python implementation uses Marshmallow validation for this field. For the PHP implementation, contact Galileo.
Pattern: Email address, 3–63 characters
Example: `"user@fakedomain.com"`

webUid.description:
Account holder's username for the Galileo-hosted website. Must be unique across the program.
Pattern: Alphanumeric, with first character a letter; case insensitive
Example: `"eharley"`

webPwd.description:
Account holder's password for the Galileo-hosted website.
Pattern: Min 8 characters: must include upper-case character, lower-case character, and a number
Example: `"4j9KH3kkdh"`

secretQuestion.description:
Account holder's secret question for the Galileo-hosted website.
Pattern: Max 50 characters: letters, spaces, `?`
Example: `"What was the name of your first pet?"`
secretQuestion.example: What was the name of your first pet?

secretAnswer.description:
Account holder's answer to `secretQuestion`.
Pattern: Max 50 characters: letters, spaces, `?`
Example: `"Larry"`

incomeSource.description:
Account holder's employer name or income source.
Pattern: Max 60 characters: alphanumeric, space, underscore, hyphen, period, `@`, `&` and comma.
Example: `"Kroger Food & Drug"`

occupation.description:
Account holder's occupation.
Pattern: Max 60 characters: alphanumeric, space, underscore, hyphen, period, `@`, `&` and comma.
Example: `"Project Manager"`

prodId.description:
Galileo-generated identifier for a product. If this ID is for a business product then `businessName` is **required**.
Pattern: Integer
Example: `501`

loadAmount.description:
Currency amount passed as a whole or decimal amount. Initial load amount on a card must be within product load limits or be the designated amount for an instant-issue card.
Pattern: Positive integer or decimal number
Example: `100.00`, `100`  or `100.73`

loadType.description:
Transaction type for the `loadAmount`. Use values from your Galileo-supplied list of load types. If no `loadType` is specified, the default type `RL` is used.
Pattern: 2 characters
Example: `"RL"`

primaryAccount.description:
<<glossary:PAN>> or <<glossary:PRN>> of the primary account to associate this account with. Populate this parameter only when creating a secondary account.
Pattern: PAN or PRN
Example: `"123456789012"`

fundingAccountNo.description:
PRN of the <<glossary:RTF>> funding account. **Required** if `prodId` is an RTF spending product.
Pattern: 12-digit numeric string
Example: `"143101204201"`

sharedBalance.description:
Specifies whether the secondary account will share the balance of the primary account. This parameter is **required** when `primaryAccount` is populated. Do not set this parameter to `1` when `primaryAccount` is not populated.
* `0` — Do not share the balance
* `1` — Share the balance

Pattern: One digit
Example: `1`

userData.description:
Data supplied by the provider, from sources external to the Galileo system. This data will be stored in the Galileo system in association with this account. The most common use of this parameter is to track affiliate-marketing traffic. The data in this field can be added to an <<glossary:RDF>>.
Pattern: Max 50 alphanumeric characters and spaces
Example: `"a4434gg44"`

verifyOnly.description:
Pass `1` to test the validity of the parameter data without committing the information to the Galileo system.
Pattern: `0` or `1`
Example: `0`

cipStatus.description:
CIP setting override. Valid only if you are using Galileo's integrated <<glossary:CIP>> solution.
* `0` or empty — Do not override the CIP setting.
* `1` — Create the customer record and run CIP but do not create an account.
* `2` — Create the customer record and account but do not run CIP.

Example: `"0"`

embossLine2.description:
Second line to emboss on the card.
Pattern: Max 28 alphanumeric characters, including hyphen (`-`)
Example: `"second emboss line"`

providerAssessedFee.description:
Fee amount assessed by the provider. This value is passed to Galileo only for informational purposes: passing this parameter does not assess the fee.
Pattern: Monetary amount greater than 0.
Example: `2.50`

loadFromAccountNo.description:
To load funds into the account at the time of account creation, specify the <<glossary:PAN>> or <<glossary:PRN>> of the source account for the funds. This account must be in the same program as the account being created.
Pattern: PAN or PRN
Example: `"123456789012"`

sweepDate.description:
The last date that a daily sweep should be performed. This parameter is valid only if account sweeping is configured for the product.
Pattern: YYYY-MM-DD
Example: `"2016-01-01"`

expressMail.description:
The type of express mail for shipping the card associated with this account. Use the values that are supported by your emboss vendor.
Pattern: `Y`, `N`, or `0-9`
Example: `"1"`

shipToAddressPermanent.description:
Pass `1` to always ship cards to the ship-to address instead of one time only.
Pattern: `1` or `0`
Example: `"1"`

shipToAddress1.description:
First ship-to address line.
Pattern: Max 40 characters
Example: `"33 business parkway"`

shipToAddress2.description:
Second ship-to address line.
Pattern: Max 30 characters
Example: `"Suite 400"`

shipToCity.description:
Ship-to city.
Pattern: Max 30 characters
Example: `"Salt Lake City"`

shipToState.description:
Ship-to state.
Pattern: 2,3-character state or province abbreviation
Example: `"UT"`

shipToPostalCode.description:
Ship-to ZIP or postal code.
Pattern: `1234`, `12345`, `12345-1234`, `K1A-1A1`
Example: `"841213333"`

shipToCountryCode.description:
Ship-to country. Three-digit UN M49 country code, such as `840` for USA, `124` for Canada, `484` for Mexico, `170` for Colombia.
Pattern: 3-digit number
Example: `"840"`

businessName.description: Account holder's business name. This field is **required** if `prodId` is a business product. Pattern: 2-150 characters. See the supported character set. Example: `"Ed%26Ted"`

mobilePhoneCountryCode.description: Account holder's mobile phone country code. Pattern: A plus sign followed by 1–3 digits. See Phone Validation for valid values. Example: `"+1"`

apiLogin.description:
Web service username, as provided by Galileo.
Pattern: Max 50 characters
Example: `"AbC123-9999"`

apiTransKey.description:
Web service password, as provided by Galileo.
Pattern: Max 15 characters
Example: `"4sb62fh6w4h7w34g"`

providerId.description:
Galileo-issued provider identifier.
Pattern: Max 10 digits
Example: `9999`

transactionId.description:
A unique provider-generated ID to identify this API call. A UUID is preferred.
Pattern: 60 characters or less
Example: `"9845dk-39fdk3fj3-4483483478"`

accountNo.description:
The <<glossary:PRN>> or <<glossary:PAN>> of the account.
Pattern: PAN or PRN
Example: `"074103447228"`

includeRelated.description: Whether to return data for related accounts. See Getting related account information for instructions on using this parameter. Default is `1`. Pattern: `0` or `1` Example: `0`

post.description:
Use the Get Account Cards endpoint to retrieve a customer's profile information along with all accounts and cards that are associated with that customer, regardless of status.

[block:callout]

{
"type": "info",
"title": "Note",
"body": "You can receive PCI-sensitive information only if your provider parameters permit it."
}
[/block]

post.description: Use the Modify Status endpoint to change the status of an account, a card, or both. This endpoint does not change any other kind of status. - Consult the Modify Status Types enumeration to see what is affected by each `type` value. - Use this endpoint with `type: 7` to activate a virtual card; for physical card activation use the Activate Card endpoint. - See the Lost, Stolen, or Damaged Cards guide for instructions on using types `8` and `9`.

apiLogin.description:
Web service username, as provided by Galileo.
Pattern: Max 50 characters
Example: `"AbC123-9999"`

apiTransKey.description:
Web service password, as provided by Galileo.
Pattern: Max 15 characters
Example: `"4sb62fh6w4h7w34g"`

providerId.description:
Galileo-issued provider identifier.
Pattern: Max 10 digits
Example: `9999`

transactionId.description:
A unique provider-generated ID to identify this API call. A UUID is preferred.
Pattern: 60 characters or less
Example: `"9845dk-39fdk3fj3-4483483478"`

accountNo.description:
The <<glossary:PRN>>, <<glossary:PAN>> or <<glossary:CAD>> of the account.
Pattern: PAN, PRN, or CAD
Example: `"074103447228"`

type.description: Specifies the account and/or card status to set. See the Modify Status Types enumeration for valid values. Pattern: Predefined integer value range Example: `2`

startDate.description:
Valid only with `type: 17` (freeze card). If you pass a value for `startDate`, you must also populate `endDate`. Default is current date-time.
Pattern: `YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss`
Example: `"2020-02-02 12:22:02"`

endDate.description:
Valid only with `type: 17` (freeze card). If you pass a value for `endDate`, you must also populate `startDate`. Must be later than `startDate`. Default is current date-time plus 24 hours.
Pattern: `YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss`
Example: `"2020-02-12 10:00:00"`

bypassRepFee.description:
Valid only when `type: 19`. Pass `Y` to bypass the card replacement fee (REP).
Pattern: `Y` or `N`
Example: `"Y"`

cardNumberLastFour.description:
If multiple cards are associated with this account, use this value to ensure that the correct card is selected.
Pattern: 4 digits
Example: `"0789"`

closureReason.description:
Specifies the account closure reason to be reported to credit bureaus:
* `chargeoff` — Unpaid, closed by issuer, and charged off
* `collection` — Unpaid and closed by issuer
* `deleted_fraud` — Account takeover fraud, closed by issuer
* `inactivity` — Paid and closed by issuer due to inactivity
* `paid_user` — Paid and closed at the customer's request

Only valid when `type` contains `2`, `13`, `16` or `20`. Default: `paid_user`.
Pattern: Strings shown above
Example: `inactivity`

bypassMailFee.description:
Controls whether to charge the express mail fee for the reissued card. Default: blank.
Pattern: `Y` or blank
Example: `Y`

post.description: Use the Update Account endpoint to modify customer profile information in an existing customer record. Pass only the parameters to modify — other parameters should be left blank. Only active accounts (`status: N`) can be updated using this endpoint. #### Nullifying data elements Pass the string `null` for any of these parameters to update that value to `null`. | | | | | |:--|:--|:--|:--| | `firstName` | `middleName` | `lastName` | `address1` | | `city` | `state` | `postalCode` | `primaryPhone` | | `otherPhone` | `mobilePhone` | `shipToAddress1` | `webUid` | | `secretQuestion` | `secretAnswer` | `mailBounced` | `email`\* | | `embossLine2` | | | | \*Only if the provider parameter AENUL permits it. [block:callout] { "type": "warning", "title": "Warning", "body": "Exercise caution when nullifying a primary address — for compliance in the United States you must maintain a physical address as an individual cardholder's primary address." } [/block] #### Updating customer ID When you are using Galileo's integrated CIP process, you can update the primary customer ID (`id` and `idType`) as long as the customer has not passed <>. If the customer has already passed CIP, status code 415-02 is returned. Secondary customer ID (`id2` and `idType2`) can be updated regardless of customer CIP status. #### Updating the ship-to address When updating the ship-to address for a customer, the elements `shipToAddress1`, `shipToCity`, `shipToState`, and `shipToPostalCode` are required – `shipToAddress2` is optional. You can retrieve the current customer ship-to address data using the Get Account Card endpoint. By default, the embosser sends the card to the primary address. To ship to a different address than the primary, use the ship-to address fields. If you pass `shipToAddressPermanent: 1` the embosser will always send cards to the ship-to address; otherwise, the ship-to address is used only for the current order.

Example: `"AbC123-9999"`

apiTransKey.description:
Web service password, as provided by Galileo.
Pattern: Max 15 characters
Example: `"4sb62fh6w4h7w34g"`

providerId.description:
Galileo-issued provider identifier.
Pattern: Max 10 digits
Example: `9999`

transactionId.description:
A unique provider-generated ID to identify this API call. A UUID is preferred.
Pattern: 60 characters or less
Example: `"9845dk-39fdk3fj3-4483483478"`

accountNo.description:
The <<glossary:PRN>> or <<glossary:PAN>> of the account.
Pattern: PAN or PRN
Example: `"074103447228"`

idType.description: Specifies the type of primary identifier in the `id` parameter. This parameter is **required** when `id` is populated. See the **ID** column in the Customer ID Types table for valid values. Pattern: 1- or 2-digit integer Example: `2`

id.description: The value of the primary identifier that is specified in `idType`. Product settings determine whether this ID should be unique across the program or product. This parameter is **required** when using Galileo's integrated <> solution. Pattern: As specified in the **Layout** column of the Customer ID Types enumeration Example: `"123456789"`

idType2.description: Specifies the type of secondary identifier in the `id2` parameter. This parameter is **required** when `id2` is populated. See the **ID** column in the Customer ID Types table for valid values. Pattern: 1- or 2-digit integer Example: `1`

id2.description: The value of the secondary identifier that is specified in `idType2`. Pattern: As specified in the **Layout** column of the Customer ID Types enumeration Example: `"123456789012|UT|12/25/2020"`

locationType.description:
Type of ID in `location`:
* `0` — Galileo location ID
* `1` — Partner location ID
* `2` — Don't validate

Pattern: `0`, `1`, or `2`
Example: `0`

location.description: Unique location identifier (`location`) as returned by the Create Location endpoint. This value is also returned by the Get Locations endpoint depending on the value of `locationType` when the location was created: * `0` or `2` — Returned in the `location_id` field * `1` — Returned in the `provider_specified_id` field Pattern: Integer if `locationType: 0` or `locationType: 2`; max 15 characters if `locationType: 1` Example: `"a455-3483"`

locale.description:
The account holder language and localization preference. Default is `en_US`. Valid values are `en_US`, `es_US`, `fr_CA`, `en_CA`, `es_MX`, `en_MX`. If the account holder address is outside the U.S., pass a non `_US` value for this parameter to disable U.S. address validation.
Pattern: Letters with underscore
Example: `"en_US"`

externalAccountId.description:
Identifier supplied by the provider, which is not related to the Galileo system. This ID is stored in the Galileo system in association with this account and can be provided in the <<glossary:RDF>>s.
Pattern: Max 30 alphanumeric characters. Lowercase only.
Example: `"553b45sbs"`

firstName.description: Account holder's first name. Special character support. Pattern: 1–40 characters: letters (`A-Z`, `a-z`), spaces, hyphens (`-`) and single quotes (`'`) Example: `"Ed"`

middleName.description: Account holder's middle name. Special character support. Pattern: 1–40 characters: letters (`A-Z`, `a-z`), spaces, hyphens (`-`) and single quotes (`'`) Example: `"W"`

lastName.description: Account holder's last name. Special character support. Pattern: 1–40 characters: letters (`A-Z`, `a-z`), spaces, hyphens (`-`) and single quotes (`'`) Example: `"Harley"`

dateOfBirth.description:
Account holder's birth date. This date is compared with the DOB product parameter when there is a minimum age requirement on the account.
Pattern: YYYY-MM-DD
Example: `"1980-01-01"`

address1.description: Account holder's first address line. Cannot be a P.O. box. Validation rules for `address1`. Pattern: 4–40 alphanumeric characters Example: `"33 Maple Street"`

address2.description: Account holder's second address line. Character set for address lines. Pattern: Max 40 characters Example: `"#4B"`

address3.description: Account holder's third address line. Character set for address lines. Pattern: Max 30 characters Example: `"Carrera Central"`

address4.description: Account holder's fourth address line. Character set for address lines. Pattern: Max 30 characters Example: `"Barrio El Alhambra"`

address5.description: Account holder's fifth address line. Character set for address lines. Pattern: Max 30 characters Example: `"Piso 3"`

city.description:
Account holder's city.
Pattern: Max 30 characters: letters, spaces, hyphen and period
Example: `"Salt Lake City"`

state.description:
Account holder's state or province.
Pattern: 2,3-character state or province abbreviation
Example: `"UT"`

postalCode.description:
Account holder's postal code (ZIP code).
Pattern: `1234`, `12345`, `12345-1234`, or `K1A-1A1`
Example: `"84121"`

countryCode.description:
Account holder's country. Three-digit UN M49 code, such as `840` for USA, `124` for Canada, `484` for Mexico, `170` for Colombia.
Pattern: 3-digit number
Example: `"840"`

primaryPhone.description:
Account holder's primary phone number. When passing a value for this parameter, you must also pass `mobilePhoneCountryCode`.
Pattern: Validation according to the value in `mobilePhoneCountryCode`.
 Example: `"8015556060"`

otherPhone.description:
Account holder's secondary phone number. When passing a value for this parameter, you must also pass `mobilePhoneCountryCode`.
Pattern: Validation according to the value in `mobilePhoneCountryCode`.
 Example: `"8015556060"`

mobilePhone.description:
Account holder's mobile phone number. When passing a value for this parameter, you must also pass `mobilePhoneCountryCode`.
Pattern: Validation according to the value in `mobilePhoneCountryCode`.
 Example: `"8015556060"`

mobileCarrierId.description:
Account holder's mobile carrier. Configurable list.
Pattern: Configurable list
Example: `"8"`

email.description:
Account holder's email. The Python implementation uses Marshmallow validation for this field. For the PHP implementation, contact Galileo.
Pattern: Email address, 3–63 characters
Example: `"user@fakedomain.com"`

webUid.description:
Account holder's username for the Galileo-hosted website. Must be unique across the program.
Pattern: Alphanumeric, with first character a letter; case insensitive
Example: `"eharley"`

webPwd.description:
Account holder's password for the Galileo-hosted website.
Pattern: Min 8 characters: must include upper-case character, lower-case character, and a number
Example: `"4j9KH3kkdh"`

secretQuestion.description:
Account holder's secret question for the Galileo-hosted website.
Pattern: Max 50 characters: letters, spaces, `?`
Example: `"What was the name of your first pet?"`
secretQuestion.example: What was the name of your first pet?

secretAnswer.description:
Account holder's answer to `secretQuestion`.
Pattern: Max 50 characters: letters, spaces, `?`
Example: `"Larry"`

incomeSource.description:
Account holder's employer name or income source.
Pattern: Max 60 characters: alphanumeric, space, underscore, hyphen, period, `@`, `&` and comma.
Example: `"Kroger Food & Drug"`

occupation.description:
Account holder's occupation.
Pattern: Max 60 characters: alphanumeric, space, underscore, hyphen, period, `@`, `&` and comma.
Example: `"Project Manager"`

mailBounced.description:
`Y` indicates that mail has been returned to sender.
Pattern: `Y` or `N`
Example: `"Y"`

shipToAddress1.description:
First ship-to address line.
Pattern: Max 40 characters
Example: `"33 business parkway"`

shipToAddress2.description:
Second ship-to address line.
Pattern: Max 30 characters
Example: `"Suite 400"`

shipToCity.description:
Ship-to city.
Pattern: Max 30 characters
Example: `"Salt Lake City"`

shipToState.description:

Pattern: 2,3-character state or province abbreviation
Example: `"UT"`

shipToPostalCode.description:

Pattern: `1234`, `12345`, `12345-1234`, `K1A-1A1`
Example: `"841213333"`

shipToCountryCode.description:
Ship-to country. Three-digit UN M49 country code, such as `840` for USA, `124` for Canada, `484` for Mexico, `170` for Colombia.
Pattern: 3-digit number
Example: `"840"`

shipToAddressPermanent.description:
Pass `1` to always ship cards to the ship-to address instead of one time only.
Pattern: `0` or `1`
Example: `"1"`

embossLine2.description:
Second line to emboss on the card.
Pattern: Max 28 alphanumeric characters, including hyphen (`-`)
Example: `"second emboss line"`

businessName.description: Account holder's business name. This field is **required** if `prodId` is a business product. Pattern: 2-150 characters. See the supported character set. Example: `"Ed%26Ted"`

mobilePhoneCountryCode.description: Account holder's mobile phone country code. Pattern: A plus sign followed by 1–3 digits. See Phone Validation for valid values. Example: `"+1"`

amount.description:
Currency amount as a whole or decimal amount.
Pattern: Positive integer or decimal number
Example: `100.00`, `100`, or `100.73`

description.description:
Description for the ACH transfer.
Pattern: Alphanumeric and punctuation, max 30 characters
Example: `One time payroll load.`

remittanceInfo.description:
Populate with any available context for the ACH payment.
Galileo populates the value within the Payment Related Information fieldof the ACH Addenda Record in the outgoing ACH file.
Pattern: Alphanumeric and punctuation, max 80 characters
Example: `"Payoff 2500 transfer initiated and verified to Acct 12345678."`
remittanceInfo.example: Payoff 2500 transfer initiated and verified to Acct 12345678.

debitCreditIndicator.description:
Specifies whether the recipient account is to be credited or debited. Default: `D`.
* `C` — Credit
* `D` — Debit

Pattern: `D` or `C`
Example: `D`

sameDay.description:
Specifies whether this is a same-day transaction.
Pattern: `Y` or `N`
Example: `Y`

identNumber.description: Provider-supplied identifier, external to the Galileo system. This value is only required for the `CIE` and `WEB` SEC codes. Pattern: Max 15 characters Example: `"123456789"`

processorToken.description:
Obtained from Plaid if using Plaid integration. Checks the balance of the ACH account to verify that there are sufficient funds for an ACH debit.
Pattern: String
Example: `"processor-production-35cd43b-adfc-d8aa-b331-c9ba0fdha881"`

holdDays.description:
The number of hold days to apply to this transaction, which overrides the hold days in product settings. This value applies only to outgoing ACH debits (`debitCreditIndicator: D`). This parameter is available only to clients who have obtained bank approval to use it. The ACOHD parameter must be set to use this parameter.
Pattern: Positive integer
Example: 2

post.description: Use the Create ACH Transaction endpoint to originate an ACH transaction to move funds between a customer account (`accountNo`) and an existing ACH bank account (`achAccountId`). Use the Add ACH Account endpoint to add an ACH bank account. For more information on this endpoint see Creating an ACH transaction in the *ACH Endpoints* guide.

post.description: Use the Add Paper Biller endpoint to create a custom paper biller for a customer and to schedule paper bill payments. Billers that are created with this endpoint will receive a paper check instead of an electronic payment. The account must be active (`status: N`) to use this endpoint. See Creating a Billpay Transaction for further instructions on using this endpoint.

Example: `"My Landlord"`

billerAccountNo.description: Account number that the account holder has with the biller. This value is not validated against a formatting mask. If there is no account number for the biller, pass `n/a`. You cannot edit this value with Modify Paper Biller. If the account holder submits an incorrect value, you must remove the biller and create the biller again with the correct account number. Pattern: Alphanumeric string including hyphens and spaces. Example: `"3333223323455555"`

frequencyType.description:
Frequency of the bill payment:
* `O` — One time
* `W` — Weekly
* `M` — Monthly
* `Q` — Quarterly
* `Y` — Yearly

If this value is not `O` then `nextDate` and `endDate` are **required**.
Pattern: One letter
Example: `"W"`

nextDate.description:
The next date that the payment is scheduled.
Pattern: YYYY-MM-DD
Example: `"2015-02-04"`

endDate.description:
The last date that the payment is scheduled. Can be up to five years in the future, so if today is 20 Jan 2020, this parameter can be no later than 20 Jan 2025. However, if today's date is a leap day, such as 29 Feb 2020, the latest date can be 1 Mar 2025.
Pattern: YYYY-MM-DD
Example: `"2015-02-04"`

amount.description:
Currency amount as a whole or decimal amount.
Pattern: Positive integer or decimal number
Example: `100.00`, `100`, or `100.73`

post.description: Use the Cancel Bill Payment endpoint to cancel a billpay transaction. You cannot cancel an electronic (<>) payment with this endpoint. post.description: Use the Modify RPPS Biller endpoint to update an <<glossary:RPPS>> biller. All non-required fields are nullifiable. To cancel a scheduled series, either set `endDate` to the current date or pass `Null` for `frequencyType`, `nextDate` and `endDate`. The account must be active (`status: N`) to use this endpoint.

apiLogin.description:
Web service username, as provided by Galileo.
Pattern: Max 50 characters
Example: `"AbC123-9999"`

apiTransKey.description:
Web service password, as provided by Galileo.
Pattern: Max 15 characters
Example: `"4sb62fh6w4h7w34g"`

providerId.description:
Galileo-issued provider identifier.
Pattern: Max 10 digits
Example: `9999`

transactionId.description:
A unique provider-generated ID to identify this API call. A UUID is preferred.
Pattern: 60 characters or less
Example: `"9845dk-39fdk3fj3-4483483478"`

accountNo.description:
The <<glossary:PRN>> or <<glossary:PAN>> of the account.
Pattern: PAN or PRN 
Example: `"074103447228"`

billerId.description: Identifier for the biller (`biller_id`) as returned by the Add RPPS Biller or Get Billers endpoint. Do not use the `rpps_biller_id` from Search Biller Directory. Pattern: Integer Example: `2982`

frequencyType.description:
Frequency of the bill payment:
* `O` — One time
* `W` — Weekly
* `M` — Monthly
* `Q` — Quarterly
* `Y` — Yearly

If this value is not `O` then `nextDate` and `endDate` are **required**.
Pattern: One letter
Example: `"W"`

nextDate.description:
The next date that the payment is scheduled.
Pattern: YYYY-MM-DD
Example: `"2015-02-04"`

endDate.description:
The last date that the payment is scheduled. Can be up to five years in the future, so if today is 20 Jan 2020, this parameter can be no later than 20 Jan 2025. However, if today's date is a leap day, such as 29 Feb 2020, the latest date can be 1 Mar 2025.
Pattern: YYYY-MM-DD
Example: `"2015-02-04"`

amount.description:
Currency amount as a whole or decimal amount.
Pattern: Positive integer or decimal number
Example: `100.00`, `100`, or `100.73`

post.description: Use the Get Access Token endpoint to retrieve an access token for a card, account, or customer record. The expiry in seconds (default: 300) and usage count (default: 3) for the access token are configurable using the TSECV (seconds) and TUSEC (usage) parameters. When `type: 0` always use CAD for `accountNo`. Use this endpoint to send a customer a link to a one-time view of a dynamically generated image of a virtual card via HTTP, for example, or for other purposes as appropriate. Consult Digital card images in the *Retrieving Card Information* guide for more information. For other uses contact Galileo.

singleUse.description:
Spending control to limit the card to one purchase transaction. This is available only for credit programs.
Pattern: `Y` or `N`
Example: `"Y"`

post.description: Use the Add Card endpoint to add a new card (<> and <>) to an existing <>. Cards that are created with this endpoint are active upon creation, and Galileo recommends that you have only one active card per PRN. As needed, ensure that any previous card has been marked lost, stolen, canceled, or any status but `N`. Do not use this endpoint to create multiple spending cards that share a central balance. For that use case, Galileo recommends Real-Time Funding or Corporate Credit for large numbers of cards, or for small numbers of cards you can create one primary and multiple secondary accounts that share a balance. Use this endpoint in scenarios such as these: - Replacing a virtual card that is lost, stolen, or expired - Adding another virtual card to a PRN - Replacing an instant-issue card at a storefront (for card programs with a retail integration) - Replacing a personalized card

accountNo.description:

walletProvider.description:
The type of wallet to provision:
* `1` — Apple Pay
* `2` — Google Pay
* `3` — Samsung Pay

Pattern: One digit
Example: `2`

cert1.description: The leaf certificate returned by the wallet provider that was signed using `cert2`. Should be the hexlified (case insensitive) binary data of the certificate. See Certificate formatting for more information. Required for Apple Pay; not required for Samsung Pay or Google Pay.

cert2.description: The subordinate certificate returned by the wallet provider that was signed using the wallet provider’s Certificate Authority (CA) certificate. Should be the hexlified (case insensitive) binary data of the certificate. See Certificate formatting for more information. Required for Apple Pay; not required for Samsung Pay or Google Pay.

nonce.description:
The hexlified (case insensitive) nonce value returned by Apple Pay. **Required** for Apple Pay; not required for Google Pay or Samsung Pay.

Example: `"9c023092"`

nonceSignature.description:

Pattern: Nonce signature value
Example: `"4082f883ae62..."`

clientWalletAccountID.description: Value returned by Google Pay or Samsung Pay for use with Visa. **Required** for Visa + Samsung Pay or Google Pay; not required for Visa + Apple Pay.

clientDeviceID.description: Value returned by Google Pay or Samsung Pay for use with Visa. **Required** for Visa + Samsung Pay or Google Pay; not required for Visa + Apple Pay.

post.description:
Use the Ping endpoint to test API connectivity and permissions. Ping does not perform any functions on the Galileo system. Some use cases for Ping are:
* Testing access from an automated monitoring service
* Integrating with an API call to confirm assumptions and validate access

Use the Create Simulated Card Authorization endpoint to simulate a card authorization in the <> environment. This endpoint creates but does not settle a card authorization for the account and returns a response code and its description with the `auth_id`. - Capture the `auth_id` to settle the transaction with Create Simulated Card Settlement. - For instructions on using this endpoint see Simulating Card Transactions. [block:callout] { "type": "warning", "title": "Warning", "body": "Do not use this endpoint in <>." } [/block]

apiLogin.description:
Web service username, as provided by Galileo.
Pattern: Max 50 characters
Example: `"AbC123-9999"`

apiTransKey.description:
Web service password, as provided by Galileo.
Pattern: Max 15 characters
Example: `"4sb62fh6w4h7w34g"`

providerId.description:
Galileo-issued provider identifier.
Pattern: Max 10 digits
Example: `9999`

transactionId.description:
A unique provider-generated ID to identify this API call. A UUID is preferred.
Pattern: 60 characters or less
Example: `"9845dk-39fdk3fj3-4483483478"`

accountNo.description:
The <<glossary:PRN>> or <<glossary:PAN>> of the account.
Pattern: PAN or PRN 
Example: `"074103447228"`

amount.description:
The amount of the transaction in the currency at the point of sale.
Pattern: Positive integer or decimal number
Example: `100.00`, `100`, or `100.73`

association.description:
Specifies which card network to simulate: `visa` (Visa), `star` (STAR), `mc_auth` (Mastercard), or `visa_baseii` (Visa Base II).
Pattern: `visa`, `mc_auth`, `visa_baseii, `star`
Example: `"visa"`

merchantName.description:
Simulated merchant name. Pass 40 characters for the complete string or pass up to 22 characters and the simulator will add 18 characters of a simulated address. For settlements, this parameter is **required** when `authId` is not populated.
Pattern: Max 40 alphanumeric characters
Example: `"Fred Jones Bagels"`

acquirerId.description:
Simulated acquirer ID. If this value is not passed, the simulator inserts a random 6-digit number.
Pattern: 6-digit number
Example: `437723`

terminalId.description:
Simulated terminal ID. If this value is not passed, the simulator inserts a random 8-digit number.
Pattern: 8-digit number
Example: `57395783`

merchantId.description:
Simulated merchant ID. If this value is not passed, the simulator inserts a random 15-character alphanumeric string.
Pattern: Max 15 alphanumeric characters
Example: `"asdf45sdf6sd3d0a"`

currencyCode.description:
The currency code for `amount`. Use ISO 4217 numeric currency codes. This parameter is required when using this endpoint outside the United States.
Pattern: 3 digits
Example: `"840"`

settleAmount.description:
The amount to be transferred from merchant to issuer in the settlement currency. Required when `specialFunctions: make_multicurrency`
Pattern: Positive integer or decimal number
Example: `100.00`, `100`, or `100.73`

settleCurrencyCode.description:
The currency code for `settleAmount`. Use ISO 4217 numeric currency codes. Required when `specialFunctions: make_multicurrency`.
Pattern: 3 digits
Example: `"124"`

cardBillingAmount.description:
The amount that will be posted to the cardholder account in the currency of the account. Required when `specialFunctions: make_multicurrency`.
Pattern: Positive integer or decimal number
Example: `100.00`, `100`, or `100.73`

cardBillingCurrencyCode.description:
The currency code for `cardBillingAmount`. Use ISO 4217 numeric currency codes. Required when `specialFunctions: make_multicurrency`.
Pattern: 3 digits
Example: `484`

mcc.description:
ISO 18245 merchant category code.
Pattern: 4 digits
Example: `3408`

originalAuthId.description:
The `auth_id` of the previous authorization in a series, such as with a completion, reversal or incremental authorization. Required when `transType` is `3`, `4`, `5` or `6` (Visa) or `3` (Mastercard) or `4`, `5`, `6` (Star).
Pattern: Numerals
Example: `30582`

specialFunctions.description: Additional function to add to the simulated transaction. See the Special Functions enumeration for valid values. Pattern: Max 100 characters Example `"add_cashback"`

posEntryMode.description: The first two characters of DE022. Specifies how the PAN was entered, such as magnetic stripe, EMV chip or contactless. See DE022 Codes for possible values. Valid only when `association: visa`. Pattern: 2 characters Example: `01`

requesterId.description:
An identifier for the entity that makes a tokenization request. Required when `specialFunctions: make_tokenized`.
Pattern: Numerals
Example: `3030303`

walletId.description:
Identifier for the mobile wallet that contains the card that was used for the transaction. Required when `association: mc_auth` and `specialFunctions: make_tokenized`.
Pattern: Numerals
Example: `474747474`

latitudeAndLongitude.description:
The latitude and longitude of the point of sale. Valid only when `association: visa` and `transType: 17`. Default: `40.76078/-111.89105` (Salt Lake City, UT)
Pattern: 99.99999/-99.99999
Example: `"40.76078/-111.89105"`

partialAmount.description:
Amount of a partial authorization.  Valid only when `association: mc_auth` and `specialFunctions: make_partial_reversal`. 
Pattern: Integer or decimal amount
Example:  `100.00`, `100`, or `100.73`

partialForeignAmount.description:
Amount of a partial authorization when the point of sale is a different country than the account. Valid only when `association: mc_auth` and `specialFunctions: make_partial_reversal`.
Pattern: Integer or decimal amount
Example:  `100.00`, `100`, or `100.73`

cashbackAmount.description:
Amount in `localAmt` that is provided in cash. Valid only when `association: mc_auth` and `specialFunctions: make_cashback`. Debit accounts only.
Pattern: Integer or decimal amount
Example: `100.00`, `100`, or `100.73`

cashAdvanceAmount.description:
Amount in `localAmt` that is provided in cash. Valid only when `association: mc_auth` and `specialFunctions: make_cashback`.  Credit accounts only.
Pattern: Positive integer or decimal number
Example: `100.00`, `100`, or `100.73`

pin.description:
To include the PIN that is already set for the card, leave this value blank and pass `specialFunctions: add_pin` (Visa) or `specialFunctions: make_debit` (Mastercard). Pass a value for this parameter to use that value in the request and also to change the PIN for the card.
Pattern: 4 digits
Example: `4395`

transType.description: The type of transaction to simulate. See the Simulated Transaction Types enumeration for valid values. Pattern: 1 or 2 digits Example: `3`

post.description: Use the Create Simulated Card Settlement endpoint to settle a simulated card authorization in the <> environment. First, create a simulated authorization using the Create Simulated Card Authorization endpoint, and then use this endpoint to settle it. - If `authId` is not populated, then `merchantName` is **required**. Populate `merchantName` but not `authId` to simulate a force-posted transaction. - For instructions on using this endpoint see Simulating Card Transactions. [block:callout] { "type": "warning", "title": "Warning", "body": "Do not use this endpoint in <>." } [/block] [block:callout] { "type": "info", "title": "Note", "body": "A simulated settlement will settle for only the amount of the card authorization — you cannot simulate an up-charge in the CV environment. For example, if the authorization amount is $10.50 and the settlement specifies $15.50, the posted settlement will be $10.50." } [/block]

post.description: Use the Create Account Transfer endpoint to move funds between accounts in the same program. You can combine a fee with the payment or adjustment, depending on what transaction types you have set up with Galileo. The accounts can belong to the same customer or different customers. If the accounts are in different programs, verify that the program parameters permit transferring funds between the programs. Pass the sending account in the `accountNo` parameter and the receiving account in the `transferToAccountNo` parameter. The receiving account should be in `status: N` (active) and the active flag set to `Y`. To permit this endpoint to drive the sending account negative, set the ALWNB parameter on the sending product. Consult the Creating an Internal Transfer guide for instructions on using this endpoint.

category_code.description: Category code for the deposit. See Deposit Category Codes for valid values.

last_updated.description: Indicates when the `source_status` was last updated

source_status.description: The source status for the ACH request. Possible values are `APPROVE`, `WATCH`, or `DECLINE`

status.description: The deposit status. See Deposit Status Codes for possible values.

post.description: Use the Get All Transaction History endpoint to retrieve all of the transactions on the Galileo ledger, including backouts, denied transactions, <>-only requests, and tokenization requests. - The `calculated_balance` is provided per transaction record. - This endpoint returns the same transactions as the *All Transactions* page in the <>. - See Record-Set Pagination for instructions on using the pagingparameters. - Open the Recipes below to see response examples.

apiLogin.description:
Web service username, as provided by Galileo.
Pattern: Max 50 characters
Example: `"AbC123-9999"`

apiTransKey.description:
Web service password, as provided by Galileo.
Pattern: Max 15 characters
Example: `"4sb62fh6w4h7w34g"`

providerId.description:
Galileo-issued provider identifier.
Pattern: Max 10 digits
Example: `9999`

transactionId.description:
A unique provider-generated ID to identify this API call. A UUID is preferred.
Pattern: 60 characters or less
Example: `"9845dk-39fdk3fj3-4483483478"`

accountNo.description:
The <<glossary:PRN>> or <<glossary:PAN>> of the account.
Pattern: PAN or PRN
Example: `"074103447228"`

startDate.description:
The beginning date for the date range, either a date or a date-time.
Pattern: YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss
Example: `"2016-01-01"`

endDate.description:
The end date for the date range, either a date or a date-time. Must be equal to or later than `startDate`. Max 1098 days (~3 years) after `startDate`. 
Pattern: YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss
Example: `"2016-01-01"`

page.description:
The number of the page to retrieve.
Pattern: Integer value of `1` or greater
Example: `3`

recordCnt.description:
The maximum number of records per page to be returned.
Pattern: Positive integer `1-99999`
Example: `100`

status_code.description: The response status code. May return a string for some statuses.

status.description: The condition of a process or response

processing_time.description: The time elapsed in processing the transaction

echo.description: A structure that contains transaction ID information

transaction_id.description: An ID that represents an API transaction

provider_timestamp.description: Store a related timestamp for reporting and troubleshooting purposes

provider_transaction_id.description: Secondary transaction identifier (generated by a provider)

rtoken.description: A Galileo-generated ID used for tracking

errors.description: A list of errors generated while the request was processed

response_data.description: A structure for the response data. It can be empty but usually will contain information.

transaction_count.description: The number of transactions listed in the response

page.description: The page number to be retrieved in the context of recordset paging

total_record_count.description: Number of records in the accounts list display

number_of_pages.description: Total number of pages in the accounts list display

start_date.description: Start date of the response

end_date.description: End date of the response

unsettled.description: The total sum of transactions that have not been settled yet

settled.description: The amount of a singled transaction that has been settled

fee.description: The sum amount charged for a service

is_savings.description: Specifies whether the transaction is made on a savings account.

deny_code.description: Two-digit code when an authorization request is denied.

disputable.description: Specifies whether the transaction can be disputed in a chargeback.

details.description: Description provided by the merchant about the transaction (DE043).

act_type.description: Activity type. See the Activity Type enumeration.

act_type_description.description: Description of `act_type`. See the Activity Type enumeration.

post_ts.description: The Galileo system date/time when a transaction posted to the customer account, in Mountain Standard Time (-0700).

amt.description: The transaction amount in the currency of the account. A negative amount debits funds from the customer account.

source_id.description: A Galileo-generated integer that maps back to the original transaction, such as `auth_id`, `pmt_id`, or `adj_id`.

type.description: The otype of the transaction. When the otype is a numeral and `act_type: SE`, the numeral is returned as a string. Other numerals are returned as integers with no leading zeros. Refer to transaction types for card-transaction values; for other transaction types, consult the otype list that Galileo gave you.

type_description.description: The description of the transaction type.

trans_code.description: A concatenation of the activity type (`act_type`) and transaction type (`type`).

arn.description: Acquirer reference number. An identifier for the acquiring processor.

external_trans_id.description: A non-Galileo identifier for a transaction, if any.

calculated_balance.description: Available balance (including this transaction) at the time the API was called.

ach_trans_id.description: A unique identifier for the ACH transaction, if applicable.

auth_ts.description: The Galileo system date/time a transaction was authorized, in Mountain Standard Time (-0700).

prior_id.description: The `auth_id` of the previous transaction in the sequence, if any.  Maps to `original_auth_id`.

card_id.description: A Galileo-generated identifier for a card, which can be used instead of the PAN. Maps to `cad`.

formatted_merchant_desc.description: The same information as in the `details` field, with formatting.

network_code.description: A Galileo-generated code to identify the subnetwork over which the transaction took place. Maps to `network_id`.

auth_id.description: A Galileo-generated identifier for an authorization and its settlement.

local_amt.description: Amount, in cents, of the authorization request, in the currency at the point of sale. 12-digit number including leading zeros. This amount does not include upcharges or program fees. (DE004)

settle_amt.description: The transaction amount, in the settlement currency (DE005)

billing_amt.description: The transaction amount, in the currency of the account (DE006)

pmt_ref_no.description: A Galileo-generated number to identify the customer account. Maps to `PRN` and `prn`.

mcc_code.description: Category code for the merchant that initiated the transaction (DE018).

credit_ind.description: Indicates whether a PIN was input at the point of sale. `Y` = No PIN was input. `N` = A PIN was input. `None` = Not a card transaction, or not processed as a card transaction.

iac_tax.description: Impuesto al Consumo. Colombian consumption tax. Required for the Mastercard Interchange Intracountry Calculation Program.

iva_tax.description: Impuesto al Valor Agregado. Colombian value-added tax. Required for the Mastercard Interchange Intracountry Calculation Program.

spending_account_prn.description: The PRN of the RTF spending account

beginning_balance.description: The account balance as of the `startDate`.

post.description: Use the Get Pending Fees endpoint to retrieve the fees that have not yet been processed against the specified customer account. Most fees are processed as soon as they are created, but if the account has insufficient funds to pay the fee, the fee will be pending until there are sufficient funds. - The response data for this endpoint is also available in the Get Account Overview response. - The response for each individual pending fee will include authorization-related transaction information, if applicable, which is in the `related_transaction` data element.
