post.summary: Get All Simulated Incoming ACH Transactions
post.description: Use the Get All Simulated Incoming ACH Transactions endpoint to return all pending simulated incoming ACH transactions that have not been processed yet. Use the Get All Transaction History endpoint for processed transactions. For instructions on using this endpoint, see Setup for Incoming ACH Transaction Simulation. [block:callout] { "type": "warning", "title": "Warning", "body": "Do not use this endpoint in <>." } [/block]

apiLogin.description:
Web service username, as provided by Galileo.
Pattern: Max 50 characters
Example: `"AbC123-9999"`

apiTransKey.description:
Web service password, as provided by Galileo.
Pattern: Max 15 characters
Example: `"4sb62fh6w4h7w34g"`

providerId.description:
Galileo-issued provider identifier.
Pattern: Max 10 digits
Example: `9999`

transactionId.description:
A unique provider-generated ID to identify this API call. A UUID is preferred.
Pattern: 60 characters or less
Example: `"9845dk-39fdk3fj3-4483483478"`

status_code.description: The response status code. May return a string for some statuses.

status.description: The condition of a process or response

processing_time.description: The time elapsed in processing the transaction

echo.description: A structure that contains transaction ID information

transaction_id.description: An ID that represents an API transaction

provider_timestamp.description: Store a related timestamp for reporting and troubleshooting purposes

provider_transaction_id.description: Secondary transaction identifier (generated by a provider)

rtoken.description: A Galileo-generated ID used for tracking

errors.description: A list of errors generated while the request was processed

response_data.description: A structure for the response data, returning all transactions recorded. Contains information when successful, empty when failed.

items.description: Returning template_values and template_name

ach_transaction_id.description: Unique identifier for the ACH transaction.

template_name.description: The name of the template used to generate the NACHA file, as set on Create Simulated Incoming ACH Transaction.

template_values.description: Returning template values as a map. See Incoming ACH Simulation Payload Values.

providerId.description:
Galileo issued unique Provider identifier.
Pattern: 10 digits or less
Example: `9999`

transactionId.description:
A unique system generated ID number that identifies the API transaction with Galileo Processing systems. A UUID is preferred. This must be different for each transaction.
Pattern: 60 characters or less
Example: `"9845dk-39fdk3fj3-4483483478"`

apiLogin.description:
Provider's web service username, as provided by Galileo for the requesting IP address.
Pattern: Max 50 characters
Example: `"AbC123-9999"`

apiTransKey.description:
Web service password, as provided by Galileo for the requesting IP address.
Pattern: Max 15 characters
Example: `"4sb62fh6w4h7w34g"`

accountNo.description:
The <<glossary:PRN>>, <<glossary:PAN>> or <<glossary:CAD>> of the account.
Pattern: PAN, PRN, or CAD
Example: `"999103447228"`

bypassRepFee.description:
Pass `Y` to bypass the card replacement fee (REP).
 Pattern: `Y` or `N`
Example: `"Y"`

cardStatus.description:
Specifies whether the card is being marked as lost (`L`) or stolen (`S`). Default: `L`. 
Pattern: `L` or `S`
Example: `L`

cardNumberLastFour.description:
If multiple cards are associated with this account, use this value to ensure that the correct card is selected.
Pattern: 4 digits
Example: `"0789"`

post.description: Use the Replace Lost/Stolen Card endpoint to report a card as lost or stolen and to request a replacement card. This endpoint is valid only for physical cards and Digital First cards. The response from this endpoint includes the new <<glossary:PAN>>, new <<glossary:expiry date>>, and new <<glossary:CVV>> for the replacement card. You must be PCI-compliant to receive the full PAN; otherwise, you will receive a masked PAN.

status_code.description: The response status code. May return a string for some statuses.

status.description: The condition of a process or response

processing_time.description: The time elapsed in processing the transaction

echo.description: A structure that contains transaction ID information

transaction_id.description: An ID that represents an API transaction

provider_timestamp.description: Store a related timestamp for reporting and troubleshooting purposes

provider_transaction_id.description: Secondary transaction identifier (generated by a provider)

rtoken.description: A Galileo-generated ID used for tracking

errors.description: A list of errors generated while the request was processed

response_data.description: A structure for the response data. It can be empty but usually will contain information.

card_number.description: The full PAN if you are PCI compliant or the masked PAN if you are not

emboss_uuid.description: UUID for an emboss record that has been sent to the embosser. When this field is present outside the `embossed_cards` object, it contains the most recent emboss UUID.

expiry_date.description: The expiry date (MMDDYYYY) of the card

card_security_code.description: The card verification value (CVV) or card verification code (CVC)

status.description: The status of this replacement card

card_id.description: The CAD for the card. Use this value instead of the PAN if you are not PCI compliant

pmt_ref_no.description: The payment reference number (PRN) of the card account

ResponseContentTypeHeaderParam.name: response-content-type
ResponseContentTypeHeaderParam.description: Use `xml` or `json` to specify the type of response. The default value is `xml`. Use this instead of the standard `accept` header.
